oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Photograph of Al Menah Temple Shriners leaving Union Station Nashville, Tennessee, for Southeastern Convention, 1959 November 03
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of the Al Menah Temple Shriners waving goodbye from the back of a train leaving Union Station in Nashville, Tennessee to attend the annual Southeastern Shrine Convention in Memphis, Tennessee where they stayed at the Peabody Hotel. The group includes Al Menah Potentate Judge Raymond Leathers, Floyd Pendelton, Potentate's Guard, and Governor and Mrs. Buford Ellington. More than 300 Shriners representing Nashville and Middle Tennessee were aboard the special 16-car train. Forms part of the Nashville Banner Archives. 1 photograph negative : b & w ; 3.25 x 4.25 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Leathers, Raymond; Pendelton, Floyd; Ellington, Buford, 1907-1972; Ellington, Catherine Ann Cheek
Ancient Arabic Order of the Nobles of the Mystic Shrine for North America. Al Menah Temple (Nashville, Tenn.); Union Station (Nashville, Tenn.)
